text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I want to share
with you how I make my soft vanilla
cookies now I know I've already done an
episode on sugar cookies but these are a
little bit different because those ones
were coated in sugar and they were
really sort of crispy on the outside and
a little bit chewy on the inside and a
lot of you we're asking me if I can do a
video on just a soft plain vanilla
cookie so I figured hey why not so this
is a perfect recipe for it's incredibly
easy takes just a few ingredients which
I'm sure you already have on hand and so
let's just go over them and get started
you'll need some all-purpose flour
granulated sugar eggs unsalted butter
room temperature salt baking powder and
vanilla extract that's it those are your
ingredients doesn't get any easier than
that now first thing you wanna do is get
your oven to 375 and then the second
thing you want to do is you can see I
have these baking sheets with my circle
on baking sheet they have ridges on them
so they don't nothing sticks to them but
if you don't have something like this
and you should probably put parchment
paper on your baking sheets just to
prevent anything from sticking now I'm
gonna make this in a bowl with just a
whisk and a spatula but if you want to
make this in a mixer go right ahead
so in this big bowl we're going to put
in our softened butter which is really
important if it's at room temperature
nice and soft and the sugar a now I'm
going to mix this together for about a
minute I want this to kind of be really
creamy because what's going to make
these cookies super buttery and soft is
by having the ingredients mix really
really well and working the eggs the
butter and the sugar so that it's nice
and fluffy that looks perfect
I'm now going to add my eggs and vanilla
extract now if I had a vanilla bean I
would probably use a vanilla bean just
because I absolutely love using vanilla
beans as much as I can but they're kind
of hard to come by where I live and when
they do come around you're very
expensive it's like $10 for one so I
sometimes try to find them online so I'm
going to do is just again whisk this for
about a minute or so until the mixture
is nice and blended and nice and fluffy
that looks perfect now I'm just going to
add in my flour and baking powder and
salt and I'm just going to mix this in
until I have everything blended that
looks perfect now using a small little
ice cream scoop I'm going to just make
little mounds and you want to place them
about three inches apart from each other
because these will spread out so make
sure you separate them and put them
apart that might even be a little too
close now I'm going to put these into
the oven for about 12 to 14 minutes and
now I'm going to rotate them halfway
through so around 6 to 7 minutes I'll
rotate the baking pans just to make sure
that they cook evenly and then I'm going
with them cool completely
before we dig in my cookies bake for
about 12 minutes and I rotated the
baking sheets halfway through it's
really important and that's it I let
them cool for a while and now they're
ready to be eaten
I'm going to show you they're very soft
and buttery exactly what you guys are
asking for get a bite very delicious
very simple very soft I hope that this
is a recipe you have been looking for
that's it
you saw obviously simply wants to make
them get in your kitchen and make it
before you do that go www.h com2 get the
recipe
